attributes.action: Make the misuse of a disabled parking bay a criminal offence.
attributes.background: It common to find, usually expensive cars using disabled bays without having a right to a Blue Badge.
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of facebook pages dedicated to bad parking which lists hundreds of cars in disabled bays not displaying a blue badge.

attributes.action: Debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils
attributes.background:
should there be a national debate whether Private finance initiative should be outlawed for local councils?
Prof Allyson Pollock, said “are consistently higher than public borrowing costs”. 
Barts Health NHS Trust will pay £7 billion for a hospital which cost £1.1 billion
attributes.additional_details:
Barts Health rebuild cost £1.1 billion but, the final cost will be more than £7 billion with the Barts Health NHS Trust making payments until 2049. 
PFI deals will cost taxpayers £209bn over next 35 years.

attributes.action: Stop NHS Surcharge Payment for Visa applications (NI contributions goes to NHS)
attributes.background: The Home Office has made it mandatory for immigrants to pay for NHS Surcharge as part of Visa application while working immigrants in the UK pay National Insurance contribution that fund other state benefits and the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Surcharge cost £200 per year and this means immigrants have to pay an excess of £200 every time they apply to renew their Visa on top of their high visa charge. For someone applying for 5 years visa, this will amount to an extra £1000. National Insurance contribution means that immigrants are already paying contribution towards funding the NHS and should be given the right to access medical treatment and not treated differently from EU and UK citizens with regards to accessing the NHS

attributes.action: Ban gambling advertising in the UK.
attributes.background: I am 26 years old and I already know over ten people who have been near crippled by gambling addiction. The fact that gambling is advertised is disgusting and should be held in the same regard as other addictive substances which get abused by people with poor mental health.
attributes.additional_details: The adverts that we see on the television take advantage of people's weaknesses, use of apps in spare time, inability to be alone or bored and position gambling as a 'light-hearted', 'sociable' way of passing the time. The actual potential that gambling had to ruin people's lives and the lives of their families and friends is catastrophic. There needs to be more onus placed on centralised government's responsibility to stopping this happening.

attributes.action: Allow and help gay couples in the uk have children through surrogacy.
attributes.background:
For gay men in the UK it is not easy to be able to have a biological family.
Surrogacy is legal however it is an offence to pay a surrogate to carry a child but you may pay their reasonable expenses, furthermore it is illegal to advertise for a surrogate.
I'd like Surrogacy made available to all
attributes.additional_details:
IVF treatment for couples that are unable to have children naturally is a fantastic way to have a precious family. Gay women are also able to have IVF treatment to be able to have a biological family which is also a blessing, but for gay men there is no way of doing this.
Women around the country are happy being surrogates but you are not allowed to advertise this making surrogacy being legal very hard to come by. The greatest gift is a gift of life to someone that cannot produce it.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to increase leg room in public spaces when sat down.
attributes.background: There should be a minimum leg room space in places like cinemas and trains of 350mm from the edge of the seat of the chair to the back of the chair in front. This will improve the experience of all, especially for people of 1950mm height, the disabled, those with loads of luggage and children etc.
attributes.additional_details: It is really differcult for me, being of approx 1950mm high to sit comfortably on a train. I often have to sit at an angle which is not good for my back and my knees are always pressed up to the chair in front of me. Because I am twisted, it takes up space from the chair next to me and this reduces the space for anyone who sits next to me, which is annoying for both of us and embarrassing for me. Though this might lead to a slight reduction in seats on trains, it will improve the journey for all

attributes.action: Publish all the rights of looked after children in one simple document.
attributes.background: Looked after children can be severely affected by discrimination, even though they have legal rights to protect them. These rights need to be published in one place to make it easy for those affected and social services to find so that they can be better enforced.
attributes.additional_details: The rights of looked after children are split between the Equality Act, the Children Act 1989, the Adoption and Children Act 2002, and the Children the Families Act 2015.

attributes.action: Formally identify Accident and Emergency Departments as a UK Emergency Service
attributes.background: Nurses and Doctors working in Accident and Emergency departments deal with life and death on a daily basis. They are currently not seen as an "Emergency Service" in the UK along with Police, Ambulance, Fire or Coastguard.
attributes.additional_details:
1) Formally identified as an emergency service by the government.

2) Sentencing guidelines to be amended to show an offence of assault against any member of staff working in the accident and emergency setting (including other staff assessing patients in the accident and emergency setting) to be shown as an aggravating factor in the Magistrates Sentencing Guidelines.

3) To make an amendment to the Emergency Workers Act 2006 to include Accident and Emergency department workers.

attributes.action: Increase the number of nights required for "Shared Care" in Child Maintenance.
attributes.background: The Child Maintenance Service deems that 52 nights of contact per year is "sharing the care" of the children. This equates to 14% of all nights in a year. This is not quality time or sharing. It is insulting to resident parents. Increase the lowest threshold for "Shared Care" to 104 nights a year.

attributes.action: Reduce Civil Court Fees to enable access to justice.
attributes.background: The Court Service made £100 million profit. The maximum court fee remains £10,000 to bring a claim and £1,090 to have a trial. Its time for the MOJ to review court fees to ensure we maintain access to justice for all.
attributes.additional_details: You are owed £220,000. You have some modest savings and need to issue court proceedings to recover your debt. You will have to pay a £10,000 court fee plus £1,090 to have a trial. There is no legal aid available anymore. You are prevented from bringing a claim simply due to the ridiculously high court fee.

attributes.action: Ban the use of mobile phones in the House of Commons
attributes.background: Our MPs should have their full attention on the issues facing our country. You wouldn't be able to sit on your phone when you should be working at any other job, so why should they!

attributes.action: Make ear piercing in under 10s illegal.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that no child should be forced to have holes punctured in to their skin until they are old enough to understand what is involved.
attributes.additional_details: If you made a hole like that in any other part of a baby/child, you would have them taken away. Just because it has a gem in it, it's different? People say “It's better to get them done when they're little because they don't remember it”... It's not compulsory.

attributes.action: Sign and Ratify the Treaty for the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons
attributes.background:
On 7 July 2017, 122 governments voted at the UN to adopt the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons. Nuclear weapons have now been categorically rejected by the international community.

“The world is over-armed and peace is under-funded …." United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon
attributes.additional_details:
The new Treaty puts nuclear weapons on the same legal footing as  biological weapons, chemical weapons, anti-personnel landmines and cluster munitions.

http://www.icanw.org/the-facts/catastrophic-harm/a-diversion-of-public-resources/

https://www.nuclearinfo.org/article/transport/foi-records-reveal-nuclear-warhead-convoy-safety-faults

http://www.icanw.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/WEBhumanitarianrisks.pdf

attributes.action: Change the law to control when fireworks can be used by the public.
attributes.background: Current law does not properly control when fireworks can be used therefore precautions cannot be taken to reduce stress caused to older people, children, those with mental health issues such as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and those with pets and livestock.
attributes.additional_details: Public use of fireworks should be restricted to 4 days either side of Bonfire Night and New Years Eve and 2 days either side of Diwali and Chinese New Year, 6pm to midnight only. Any use of fireworks, outside of the specified timings for Bonfire Night, New Years Eve, Diwali and Chinese New Year should require neighbours to be informed of the date and duration in advance.

attributes.action: Health care workers to have deaf awareness training/learn basic sign language
attributes.background: Deaf means deaf! Not hard of hearing! To often in hospital people who are deaf are treated as if they are hard of hearing/ hearing impaired.
attributes.additional_details: They are faced with healthcare professionals shouting from the end of the bed and missing out on vital decisions which are made due to poor and ineffective communication. This needs to stop, basic awareness should be incorporated in there training e.g. Writing down for the individual and confirmation of understanding. Not just relying on ineffective lip reading and poor hand gestures

attributes.action: Do Not lower ANY food safety standards to obtain trade deals with any country.
attributes.background: There is a very real risk in order to obtain trade deals the government could change our food safety standards for the worse once we have left the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Such things as food grown with currently banned pesticides, genetically modified foods (particularly unlabeled), chlorine/acid washed chicken, hormone/antibiotic growth promoters and animal by-products being fed back to livestock are all risks. All are not currently allowed here but all happen in the US and other countries


The UK  must not allow our food safety laws to be lowered, they MUST not be relaxed in order to obtain any trade deal.

attributes.action: Spend aid budget on NHS before all Non-Humanitarian Aid.
attributes.background: The NHS should benefit from funding of the Foreign Aid budget where expenditure is for Non-Humanitarian Aid. It is time front line staff are given decent a pay increase and nurses bursaries were reintroduced to encourage UK nationals to have a career in this field. More funding for mental health too

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Make any overtime worked over standard contracted hours Tax free
attributes.background: I, like most, work hard as my wife does too over 50 hours per week often working Mon-Fri and then Sat and some times Sunday to earn extra cash to give our family a better standard of life and we are then taxed on the extra hours even after our standard normal weekly wage has been deducted
attributes.additional_details: This would be a massive benefit to lots of parents and families and encourage more people to do a bit more and get rewarded and then help the economy by spending that little bit extra!

attributes.action: Stop the planned upgrade of the M6 between J2-4 until other works are complete.
attributes.background: It's has been announced that works are to begin on upgrading the M6 between J2-4 to "smart motorway". There are works ongoing between J1-2 on the M5 as well as M6 junction 16-19. These should be completed first.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times through the Midlands are already frustrating enough as it is with the amount of road work projects on going. The highways agency should not be allowed to begin another project in the region until they have completed the ones they have ongoing at the moment.

attributes.action: Change the law for unmarried couples concerning benefits when a partner dies.
attributes.background: My partner of 26 years recently died. Although we were treated as a married couple for benefits whilst he was alive as soon as he died our time together did not count any more. I couldn't register his death and am not entitled to any of the benefits widows get.
attributes.additional_details: It is not right  that you are classed as a couple in life but single after a death. The law needs to be changed so that couples who have been together for a certain number of years, especially when claiming benefits together, can be treated the same as a married couple. My grief has been worsened by constantly being told if you don't have the piece of paper you can't register his death or claim any help, as a widow/widower could, for example help with funeral costs.

attributes.action: Review the impact of Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012
attributes.background: In 2012 the the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of offenders Act (LASPO) was passed. LASPO has had a profound impact on legal aid within the UK making it harder for people to gain legal representation, leading to an increase in litigants in person & arguably preventing access to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see: 

Amnesty International Report 2012: UNITED KINGDOM: CUTS THAT HURT: THE IMPACT OF LEGAL AID CUTS IN ENGLAND ON ACCESS TO JUSTICE.

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction.
attributes.additional_details:
OBJECTIVE
-Licenced retail outlets allowed to sell knives and blades.
-Knives and blades to have concealed & tamper proof serial number.
-Registration of knives & blades via Metropolitan Police Website including Lost & Stolen.
-Photo ID, Proof of Address shown at point of sale. 
-CCTV installation means cases of identity fraud can be traced.
-Knives & Blades sold in sealed boxes - Not shelf sales.
-Ban on websites selling knives into the UK meaning a closed domestic market to Knife & Blade sales

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: Carrying defibrillators on trains could save lives. This should be made compulsory.

attributes.action: Stop! No prisoners should be allowed to have the vote
attributes.background: The Government is planning to give some prisoners the vote. The Government should hold firm and not back down to the ECHR. Prisoners lose their right to vote by committing crimes. This is a bonkers decision. The decision should be for UK parliament, not the ECHR. No prisoners should have the vote.

attributes.action: Hold a debate in the Commons about the American gun control system
attributes.background: After the Vegas massacre, The Pulse night club shooting, San Bernardino, and a shooting yesterday in Fort Collins and countless other shootings, a debate is needed in the Commons about Gun control in the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017 in the US, 12,300 deaths have been caused by guns. 3,000 deaths are people who were under 18. There's been 286 mass shootings in the US. These figures don't include 22,000 annual suicides which use guns. If the UK had a similar population to the USA 1,000 UK citizens would die annually in comparison. 
http://www.gunviolencearchive.org/  
https://www.justfacts.com/guncontrol.asp  
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/06/16/gun-violence-united-kingdom-united-states/85994716/

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum wage as a factor of the lowest paid employee's wage.
attributes.background: Wage gaps have got out of hand, meaning top earners are paid a ridiculous amount more then entry level staff. Often on a false pretense that hugh salaries attract the best candidates.  It just attracts the greedy.More people are struggling to make ends meet due to inflation driven by a skewed.
attributes.additional_details: impression of growth The average salary is distorted by excessively high wages while most people barely get by. This has driven up day to day living costs while every day workers buying power has decreased. A cap on how many times the lowest salary a company's top salary is would drive up that bottom salary and make wage distribution fairer, would equalise the housing market and boast the economy much more than 99% of money being in the hands of 1% of people.

attributes.action: Extortionate TV charges for hospital patients to be stopped. Free TV in hospital
attributes.background: Ill patients are being charged extortionate prices for TV while in hospital. An example of this an 77 year old with learning disabilities who has been in hospital for two wks has been charged over 100 pounds to watch TV. They can not read a book or play on their Ipad due to being illiterate.
attributes.additional_details:
What is this doing to their mental health and wellbeing? 
How is it fair to charge someone who is ill and on a low income 10 pound a day to watch TV. 
There are so many elderly patients waiting to be able to go home but can't until they are assessed and a care plan has been put in place. This can take months. Mental health becomes effected and the risk of catching something else could cause a longer stay in hospital. Please sign to help make hospital TV free.

attributes.action: Form a dedicated recovery/response unit on the QE2 bridge/dartford crossing/A282
attributes.background: Every day users of the QE2 bridge/ Dartford crossing have to endure horrendous queues as a result of stranded vehicles blocking the carriageway through breakdown or accident . Let's have a dedicated response team to get the lanes open asap
attributes.additional_details: With revenue of 160 million pounds last year surely a response team can be budgeted in to quickly remove stranded vehicles on the run up stretches north and south of the crossing as well as the A282 and move them to a safe place instead of waiting hours for recovery from the drivers own breakdown service or insurer. The loss to the economy must run into millions of pounds a year and creates havoc and misery for users and drivers in the surrounding areas

attributes.action: Save the Streetlighting on the A2 between Bexley and Dartford
attributes.background: The streetlights on this section of the A2 have recently been switched off. On further investigation it appears Highways England are to remove the lighting columns as they are life expired. This is ridiculous and a dangerous decision on such a busy road. Please help me to get the decision reversed.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to a Highways England who confirmed that they were being removed. Only to tell me that the white lines would be refreshed as if that would suffice!

attributes.action: Change the law, employers to offer 48hr rest periods per week to night workers
attributes.background: Working nights comes with its heightened health risks. Obesity, diabetes, heart disease, lower life expectancy etc. Jet lag is certain. Working nights disorientated, whether it's physically demanding or operating machinery is a risk to health and safety. Please keep night workers healthy and safe
attributes.additional_details: Evidence has shown that a change in ones body clock affects the immune system and metabolism. When there is only a rest period of 24 hours in a week, most night workers will work a shift until 6-9am and try to readjust their body clock to suit their day off work. When there is only a 24 hour period off work this has a severe detrimental effect on ones immune system and health. Many have commonly become disoriented, tired and even ill. This is dangerous.

attributes.action: Stop speed-limited vehicles from overtaking during peak congestion periods
attributes.background: Speed-limited vehicles performing over-taking manoeuvres cause congestion on motorways and dual carriageways during peak periods. Such manoeuvres are slow in terms of time and distance and create bottle necks. Limiting these to outside of peak periods would ease congestion.

attributes.action: Community Alarm Services should be permitted to use bus lanes without penalty.
attributes.background: We are firmly of the belief that Community Alarm Services are a vital emergency service in the community for vulnerable people. The service providers should be able to use bus lanes to speed up their travel time to their service users to reduce or prevent further injury and distress.

attributes.action: Change the NHS guidelines asking people their sexual orientation
attributes.background:
In April of 2019 the NHS guidelines will be changed requiring nurses and doctors etc to ask people their sexual orientation no matter what their appointment is about. 

This is wrong as it is personal information and should only be needed if required. Please don’t let this happen.

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: UK Government to impose trade sanctions on Venezuela, over human rights abuses.
attributes.background: Democracy has been betrayed in Venezuela. With top opposition politicians like: Leopoldo Lopez and Antonio Ledezma, being unlawfully arrested. The severity of the political crisis has triggered mass protests for months. Protests resulting in: nearly 5000 arrests; 163 deaths; 15,000 injured.
attributes.additional_details: Why should the UK Government fund a tyrannical state? A state that ignores International Human Rights Agreements, that they even co-signed. A state where the detention of the opposition is natural. In 2015, Venezuela exported $286 million worth of goods to the UK - most of which was mineral products (99.2%). The UK exports to Venezuela in 2015 amounted a total of $318 million. Although Venezuela may be an attractive source of investment for UK firms, I urge them to stop. Simply because the trade revenue enables Pres Maduro's suppression of basic human rights. The UK should impose embargo on the nation until democracy has been restored.

attributes.action: HGVs to be restricted to the slow lane only on motorways and dual carriageways
attributes.background: Due to the increase in serious road traffic accidents cause by HGVs we would like to see HGVs restricted to the slow lane on motorways and dual carriageways

attributes.action: Stop the CUTS to our armed forces.
attributes.background: The MOD have announced that our armed forces will be cut over the next few years. If this happens it means our Navy, Army and Air Force won't be able to defend this country by conventional means, and would have to rely on our nuclear capabilities instead.

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Donald Trump should be refused entry to the UK
attributes.background: On account of his support for extremist organisations, and his lack of understanding of the consequences of his rhetoric, Donald Trump is not a fit and proper person to be permitted to enter the UK.

attributes.action: Cancel Trump's proposed State Visit unless he publicly condemns Britain First.
attributes.background: President Trump has broadcast racist material produced by Britain First to his 43 million Twitter followers. This has rightly been condemned by the leaders of all mainstream UK parties, but I believe that does not go far enough to convey the strength of disgust felt across the spectrum of society.

attributes.action: Abolish Parking Charges in hospital car parks!
attributes.background:
When people visit a hospital, they have to pay to park. Whilst parking for the disabled is free, everyone else has to pay.
People should not have to pay when they visit a hospital. This should apply to both patients and visitors. Abolish Hospital Parking Charges!

attributes.action: Stop UK foreign aid to all countries that mistreat minorities in appalling ways.
attributes.background:
Spending of foreign aid has to be used to the benefit of all citizens. Countries, such as Pakistan, that continue to mistreat their minorities must not receive aid any longer: 
Asia Bibi, Christian mother of five, in prison for alleged blasphemy since 2010. 
Ahmadi mosque attacked, Chakwal, 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
References:
Asia Bibi:
bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-38222680
Ahmadi mosque attack:
dw.com/en/the-persecution-of-ahmadis-in-pakistan-and-beyond/a-36748924
More examples:
Pakistani Christian school-boy beaten to death by Muslim classmates; Death sentence for Christian accused of WhatsApp “blasphemy”:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#pakistan
Indian Church,Bibles torched in attack:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#india
Afghan ex-Muslim persecuted:
youtube.com/watch?v=Tr_VGtTV8yY

attributes.action: Make discrimination against dyslexic people illegal
attributes.background: I have Dyslexia. I went for an interview and was told that they wouldn't have me because it takes me too long to learn in a role because of my Dyslexia, even though I had the knowledge and could do the role with ease.
attributes.additional_details: If Dyslexia was a named as a disability then employers would know that they had to provide reasonable adjustments, such as extra time in training or learning a new job.

attributes.action: Exempt those giving evidence of Sexual Abuse from the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.background: When investigating cases of historical sexual abuse against children and young people many prominent accused were in positions of power and protected by Civil Servants and Military Personnel. These people were by the very nature of their job, subject to the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.additional_details:
If a true and factual finding of an individuals guilt or innocence is to be found it is essential that ALL evidence available should be disclosed, without fear of prosecution, to the investigating body by ANY person having relevant information.

This petition therefore calls upon HM Government to specifically exempt, by legislation, any person providing information to a statutory investigating body in relation to Sexual Abuse cases, irrespective of any act of Parliament they may be subject to.

attributes.action: Magazines legally required to disclose when models have been photoshopped.
attributes.background:
1.6 million people in the UK suffer from eating disorders. I believe some of this comes from the high pressure placed on women and men to be thin and toned.
One main source of this is because of the beauty standards upheld in our magazines. Women and men are photo shopped into the "perfect" figure.
attributes.additional_details:
There is such a high pressure on people to fit into the mould that is projected through magazines. This mould for women is thin, toned, bid breasts, big bum and perfect skin. For men the mould is lean and muscly, six-pack and a large package. 

Pictures in magazines cannot be something people aspire to be because they aren't real body expectation. 

France has already introduced this law to help defeat eating disorders and promote a healthy body image, I believe we should too.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: More and More Drivers are using the Footpaths to Park on, this causes a number of issue such as No consideration for the Disabled/Blind and Pushchairs where Children could run into the road, plus Damage being caused to the Footpaths due to them Not being made for Vehicles costing Money to repair.
attributes.additional_details: Very often people on Foot with Pushchairs and Disabled Scooters can Not get through which causes a Safety issue with people having to go out into the road with children in some cases, Footpaths as in the name are for people on Foot and Disabled Scooters, the Councils have to pay good Money in Repairs where they are not re enforced, this come go elsewhere to needed causes, many Drivers are just Lazy these days, London should Not be the Only place that Banned them, Not Equal and Wrong.

attributes.action: UK Govt: Help to rebuild communities affected by the mudslides in Sierra Leone
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, recognise the immediate aid provided to Sierra Leone by the UK Government in the aftermath of the horrific mudslides. We ask the Government to continue to support Sierra Leone and to set out a long term strategy to help rebuild communities destroyed by the mudslides.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.
